intro: Geraniospermum fissifolium, commonly known as the fissile-leaf geraniosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes several species of flowering plants known for their distinctive leaves and flowers. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves that are deeply lobed, giving it a unique appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Geraniospermum fissifolium is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
